summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Lieutenant's Log for the morning watch shift on August 10, 2019. It chronologically records routine prison operations and the medical emergency response for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital while CPR was in progress.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054, found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in Unit 9 South at 6:33 AM, prompting a medical emergency. CPR was performed, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate #86824-054, noted as being in a dry cell under restrictive housing (R-A) at 12:35 AM.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein in cell Z06-220, Unit 9 South. He was found unresponsive, and CPR was initiated. He was transported by ambulance to a local hospital at 7:10 AM with CPR still in progress.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, at 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein at the scene and continued during transport via ambulance to a local hospital, which departed at 7:10 AM.
The log indicates Epstein was on 'Psych Obs' (psychiatric observation) with an inmate companion, though his specific entry is not detailed in the provided text.
The log records routine prison operations, counts, and equipment checks leading up to the medical emergency.
The document is a contemporaneous official record of the events surrounding Epstein's medical crisis on the morning he died.
